It has front caliper brakes and a back-pedal rear hub.Wheel size is 20 x 1.75 and white sidewall tyres in that size are still available ! (as I discovered when I had to replace the front tyre).There has been a resurgence of interest in vintage folding bikes recently. There is currently one on eBay at about R8 800, shipping excluded. (See https://www.ebay.com/itm/275591345378)The best thing about this classic folding bike is that it is supremely practical. It is easy to ride on city streets, it handles well, it is utterly reliable and feels sturdy and comfortable. It is, after all, a Peugeot from the days when they built the venerated 504 sedan, considered by many to be one of the best cars ever seen on our roads. Its practicality is moreover combined with the versatility of a folding bike which can be easily carried in the back of an SUV or bakkie.The bike is in excellent shape, considering its age. There are some blemishes on the paintwork from an anti-rust product, and some very light surface rust on the rims and chrome surfaces. It has no serious or structural rust, having always been stored in a dry garage.
